answers.answer: Hi!The spotting can be due to hormonal contraceptive you are using or it could be due to the contraceptive not suiting you, as is possible if you have thyroid problems or PCOD. Sex for the first time also is likely to cause frictional injury which can cause spotting.I suggest you consult a gynecologist to find out the cause. Often, a change in prescription of the pill helps control this. You may also need tests to rule out anemia, diabetes, thyroid disorders, and PCOD.Take care!

question: Okay, I have been having some unusual bleeding. On the 17th of last mouth I started my period, also it was the first day I started the pill, I began on the white pill because my mother told me to start out new  And my period lasted for 4 days, after them four days I had sex for the first time and my "cherry" was poped" now its the 12th of the next month and I still have been spotting brownish red blood. What can this mean ?
title: unusual bleeding after period
